abstract_summ: We extend the traditional SEIR (Susceptible, Exposed, Infectious, Recovered) mathematical model and propose an Agent-based model to analyze the interactions between the host and the vector using: (i) our proposed algorithm to compute vector density, based on the reproductive behavior of the vector; and (ii) agent interactions to simulate transmission of virus in a spatio-temporal environment, and forecast the spread of the disease in a given area over a period of time.By developing a simulation framework that models population dynamics and the interactions of both humans and mosquitoes, we may enable epidemiologists to analyze and forecast the transmission and spread of an infectious disease in specific areas.We test the spread of the Coronavirus using three different lockdown models, and eight various combinations of constraints, which allow us to examine the efficiency of each model and constraint.In India, COVID-19 cases are steadily increasing since January 30, 2020, and the government-imposed lockdown across the country to curtail community transmission.By considering the growth rate and inhibition constant of infectious diseases, their propagation growth model is established.
title_summ: An Agent-Based Simulation of the Spread of Dengue FeverForecasting COVID-19 impact in India using pandemic waves Nonlinear Growth ModelsA Computer Simulation Study on novel Corona Virus Transmission among the People in a QueueParticle modeling of the spreading of Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19)Mathematical model of infection kinetics and its analysis for COVID-19, SARS and MERSSTATIONARY DISTRIBUTION AND EXTINCTION OF STOCHASTIC CORONAVIRUS (COVID-19) EPIDEMIC MODEL
title_abstract_phrases: We extend the traditional SEIR (Susceptible, Exposed, Infectious, Recovered) mathematical model and propose an Agent-based model to analyze the interactions between the host and the vector using: (i) our proposed algorithm to compute vector density, based on the reproductive behavior of the vector; and (ii) agent interactions to simulate transmission of virus in a spatio-temporal environment, and forecast the spread of the disease in a given area over a period of time.By developing a simulation framework that models population dynamics and the interactions of both humans and mosquitoes, we may enable epidemiologists to analyze and forecast the transmission and spread of an infectious disease in specific areas.In India, COVID-19 cases are steadily increasing since January 30, 2020, and the government-imposed lockdown across the country to curtail community transmission.Forecasting COVID-19 impact in India using pandemic waves Nonlinear Growth ModelsThe ongoing pandemic of the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) started in China and devastated a vast majority of countries.By considering the growth rate and inhibition constant of infectious diseases, their propagation growth model is established.
